column4: How can I enter in text-mode after startup, cause my HD has no bytes free of space, I can't login properly in GUI
I need to remove some files
I'd boot to liveCD, chroot to the installed system and remove some packages
I used LiveCD, but had no p[ermission to modify files (or remove)
you will if you chroot
I started nautilus as root but suddenly I can't see my partition....
you dont need nautilus, you need a chroot. I'd use root recovery mode like erUSUL suggested
yeah there is a USB bug with grub
boot to liveCD then chroot, you can then remove packages as you wish
thnx, I hope so
you can mount the partition in the places menu, you can then run: gksudo nautilus   and get write access. The partition will be mounted as it's UUID under /media
that did the dtrick!! Pffff, it got me nuts... The problem is I don't have much time, it's 00:30 h am here. Tomorrow I got to work
erUSUL once again thank you very much.
i suggest once you get booted, uninstall old kernels, this will get you ~120Mb per kernel
also uninstal openoffice and install abiword if you only use writer
lots of space saved :)
just hangout, it will timeout
really??
it's a grub 1.97 (ubuntu 9.10)
by default it should timeout and boot the deffault option
Jordan_U is right, I also don't see count down
then you will need a chroot to mess with grub some
Jordan_U , well in that case I'll try tomorrow again, cuz I need some sleep, gotta work.
